E1.focus_area: Culture Fit, Soft Skills & Red Flags
E1.philosophy: Hiring is risk management. I don't care how smart you are if you are toxic. I look for emotional intelligence, stability, and communication clarity.

skill.input: Job Description says: 'We are a flat organization with a fast-paced environment.'
skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Autonomy
PRIORITY: MUST_HAVE
HIDDEN_BAR: Must demonstrate ability to unblock oneself without waiting for manager approval.
QUOTE: flat organization
@@@

gap_effort.input: Target Skill: Autonomy | Personal DB: Led a solo research project.
gap_effort.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Autonomy
EFFORT: LOW
STRATEGY: Change 'Managed' to 'Spearheaded' to emphasize independent ownership.
EVIDENCE_STATUS: FOUND_WEAK
EVIDENCE_SNIPPET: Led a solo research project.
REUSABILITY: CONCEPT_MATCH
@@@

advisor.output_tags:

TYPE: RESUME_REWRITE
ADVICE: Emphasize end-to-end ownership and proactive delivery without supervision.
DRAFT: Spearheaded end-to-end research lifecycle for 2 years without supervision, delivering 3 publications ahead of schedule.
@@@

E2.focus_area: Tech Stack Depth, Architecture & Hard Skills
E2.philosophy: Code is liability. I don't care about buzzwords; I care about engineering maturity, trade-offs, and system constraints. If you say you know C++, I will ask about memory models.

skill.input: Job Description says: 'Experience with Rust and high-performance computing.'
skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Rust Ownership & Concurrency
PRIORITY: MUST_HAVE
HIDDEN_BAR: Expect questions on Lifetimes, Pin, and async runtimes (Tokio). Not just syntax.
QUOTE: high-performance computing
@@@

@@@

E3.focus_area: Net Saving, US Stock Tax & ROI
E3.philosophy: A career is an investment portfolio. I calculate the 'Real Net'‚Äîafter tax, cost of living, and crucially, CAPITAL GAINS TAX on your US stocks. If monthly net saving < ‚Ç¨1200, I flag it immediately.

skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Net Saving & Tax
PRIORITY: INFO

QUOTE: Amsterdam
@@@

@@@

PRIORITY: MUST_HAVE
HIDDEN_BAR: Switzerland has 0% capital gains tax for private investors. Optimal for long-term NVDA/TSMC strategy.
QUOTE: Zurich
@@@

E4.philosophy: I categorize visa policies into three buckets: 1. Explicit NO (Don't apply), 2. Explicit YES (Green light), 3. Ambiguous (Need verification). I save you from applying to black holes.

skill.input: Job Description says: 'Must be eligible to work in the EU without sponsorship.'
skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Sponsorship Policy
PRIORITY: BLOCKER
HIDDEN_BAR: Category 1: Explicit NO. Unless you have an open work permit that allows immediate transfer, do not waste time applying.
QUOTE: without sponsorship
@@@

skill.input: Job Description says: 'Visa sponsorship and relocation support provided.'
skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Sponsorship Policy
PRIORITY: NICE_TO_HAVE
HIDDEN_BAR: Category 2: Explicit YES. High-priority target. The company has a budget and legal pipeline for international hires.
QUOTE: Visa sponsorship ... provided
@@@

skill.input: Job Description says: 'Location: Berlin. (No mention of visa)'
skill.output_tags:
@@@
TOPIC: Sponsorship Policy
PRIORITY: WARNING
HIDDEN_BAR: Category 3: Ambiguous. Germany is open, but small startups may lack the 'Trusted Sponsor' status. Needs verification.
QUOTE: Berlin
@@@

EDITOR.philosophy: I am the decision maker. I filter noise, resolve conflicts between experts (prioritizing Tech over HR for tech roles), and produce a coherent, strategic narrative.

synthesis.input_conflicts: Tech Lead (E2) demands deep Rust memory management details; HR (E1) insists on emphasizing soft skills and team harmony.
synthesis.output_tags:
@@@
CONFLICT: Technical Depth (E2) vs. Communication Style (E1)
STRATEGY: Prioritize E2's technical depth for this engineering role, but frame it within E1's collaborative context using 'RFC' and 'Cross-functional' keywords.
DRAFT: Engineered high-performance Rust microservices (Tech), while establishing RFC processes to align cross-functional teams (HR).
@@@
